content: The Taj Mahal, one of the seven wonders of the world, is located on the southern bank of which river?

The Taj Mahal, a breathtaking mausoleum and one of the seven wonders of the world, is situated on the southern bank of the Yamuna River in Agra, India. This magnificent structure was commissioned by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal, and is renowned for its stunning architecture and serene surroundings. The Yamuna River plays a significant role in the design and symbolism of the Taj Mahal, adding to its overall beauty and historical significance.
